subject: Productivity
title: Implementation Intentions
description: A quick win: understand Implementation Intentions.

hook.text: I will exercise is a wish. I will run at 7 AM in the park is a plan. The second one works.

buildup.text: Implementation intentions are if-then plans that link a situation to a specific action.

discovery.text: Peter Gollwitzer's research shows they nearly double follow-through rates on intended tasks.

twist.text: The power isn't in the plan itself. It's that the brain pre-loads the decision, skipping hesitation.

climax.text: Write when, where, and how you'll start. The brain treats the plan as a settled commitment.

punchline.text: Decide the when and where. The doing follows.

quiz.question: What did Gollwitzer's research find about implementation intentions?
options: They have no effect on behavior
They only work for physical tasks
